required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Chronic and Acute Effects of Resistance Exercise on Older Subjects' Blood Pressure
clinical_study.official_title: Chronic and Acute Effects of Resistance Exercise on Older Subjects' Blood Pressure

collaborator.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico
Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo
Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior.
Associacao Fundo de Incentivo a Psicofarmcologia

brief_summary.textblock: The study aimed to evaluate the chronic and acute effects of high-intensity resistance training on blood pressure and its hemodynamic and neural determinators in healthy normotensive older subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: To investigate the chronic and acute effects of resistance training on blood pressure and its hemodynamic and neural determinators in elderly, 24 healthy normotensive older subjects were randomly divided into 2 groups: trained and control. The trained group was submitted a progressive high-intensity resistance training. Before and after 16 weeks, as well as, before and after the one training session, blood pressure (clinic and ambulatory), cardiac output (CO2 rebreathing), and autonomic modulation (spectral analysis of heart rate and blood pressure variabilities) were measured

primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure was measured by auscultatory, oscillometric and photoplethysmographic device

secondary_outcome.description: Spectral analysis of heart rate and blood pressure variabillity

arm_group.description: Progressive high intensity resistance training performed twice a week for 16 weeks, and achieving in 7 exercises for the main muscles, the protocol of 4 sets of 6RM and 2 of 4RM.

intervention.description: Progressive high intensity resistance training performed twice a week for 16 weeks, and achieving in 7 exercises for the main muscles, the protocol of 4 sets of 6RM and 2 of 4RM.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 60 to 80 years
- Normotensives
- Nonactive
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cardiovascular disease
- Cardiovascular medication
- Orthopedic problems

overall_official.affiliation: School of Physical Education and Sport, University of São Paulo

facility.name: School of Physical Education and Sport, University of São Paulo

responsible_party.organization: School of Physical Education, University of São Paulo
